epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.epd_produced_by_address: Level 3, Greenhouse, 180 George Street, Sydney NSW 2000 Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.product_use: General use concrete (e.g. foot path, slabs, foundations, normal class)
product_description.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)
product_description.product_description: Concrete is prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. The fresh concrete is placed on the building site or prefabricated in factory moulds, compacted and hardened by hydration of cement.

concrete_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
concrete_classes.special_class: Typically supplied to major construction projects including high rise buildings, dams, spillways, roads, bridges, public works infrastructure, with high-strength, high durability, marine application, post-tensioned, high-pumpability, super workable, piling concrete, architectural off-form finishes and decorative applications.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None of the products contain substances listed in the Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern for authorisation.
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging.

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options modules A4-A5, modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

lca_information.allocation: Physical allocation based on weight at quarry and m³ of concrete at batching plant; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible; fly ash and silica fumes considered waste and burden-free; ground granulated blast furnace slag allocated economically.

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered via trucks and ships without packaging.

data_quality.geographic_representativeness: Good to very good for all data sources
data_quality.temporal_representativeness: All data updated within 10 years as required by PCR 2019:14

installation.operational_control: Holcim does not have operational control over installation
installation.description: Pouring of concrete from ready-mix truck and pump; manual finishing; no additional inputs modelled.

deconstruction.method: Physical process of drilling and removing concrete using hydraulic excavator

end_of_life.notes: 100% of product assumed separately collected; delivery distance assumed due to lack of primary data.

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process where concrete absorbs CO2 from atmosphere through chemical reaction; reduces net CO2 emissions over lifetime.

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Allocated economically based on value at collection
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material; only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach adopted for secondary data and processes
recycled_materials_handling.recycled_aggregate_use: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

additional_info.product_safety: Classified as Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

other_life_cycle_stages_not_included.note: These stages are deemed not applicable for Holcim's ready-mix concrete ranges.

references: Australian Life Cycle Inventory Database Initiative (2023)
British Standards Institution BS EN 15804:2012+A2:2019 and BS EN 16757:2017
Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water National Waste Report 2022
EPD International General Programme Instructions V4.0 and PCR2019:14 V1.3.4
Man Yu et al., Procedia Engineering, 2017
